benchmark_details.name: MATHSTICKS
benchmark_details.overview: MATHSTICKS is a benchmark for Visual Symbolic Compositional Reasoning (VSCR) that unifies visual perception, symbolic manipulation, and arithmetic consistency through matchstick puzzles. Models must correct invalid matchstick equations by moving one or two sticks while maintaining stick conservation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a rigorous testbed for advancing compositional reasoning across vision and symbols.

data.source: Generated matchstick instances with a two-stage generation pipeline ensuring mathematical solvability and visual fidelity.
data.annotation: Automatically generated via symbolic enumeration and visual rendering, with diagnostic labels for complexity.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on model correctness against a ground-truth set of matchstick configurations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy reflects better reasoning and visual-symbolic manipulation capabilities.
methodology.validation: Validated through experiments with 14 vision-language models and human participants.
